page.title: 01Tourism/Ecology near Newquay
page.content: The area which we are describing is criss-crossed by numerous narrow country roads which are kept in good condition because people are coming to live in the countryside and converting old barns and farmhouses.They come here to live because of the peace and to be in reach of the beaches which are a couple of miles away in Newquay, now a very popular holiday resort. This peace is occasionally shattered by Nimrod reconnaissance aircraft from nearby R.A.F. St. Mawgan. The hedgerows are well looked after, carefully trimmed back, not just hacked down with grass-cutters. Some of the flowers that grow here are honey-suckle, cow-parsley, elderflower and fox-gloves.There is a little arable and pastoral farming but the land is undulating and the area exposed to strong winds.
